intro: Myosotis radix-palaris, commonly known as the pale alpine forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has a short, hairy stem and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. Myosotis radix-palaris is typically found in alpine meadows and mountainous areas where it withstands cold temperatures and strong winds.
